ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Occasional 1-1 virtual meetings outside of weekly virtual seminar

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: How to develop, become aware of, and articular one's methodology as a graphic designer, and how to create design in a way that makes a designer aware of their inspirations, motivations, processes, tools, and methodologies.
Expanded my skills/knowledge on graphic design, with more concentration on how words and image relate to each other
Understanding graphic design methodology, generating large quantities of ideas in a short span of time

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The one weakness of this course is that it was 4 hours long over Zoom. If it had been in person, I am sure that the length would not have mattered so much, and, of course, the need for online learning is out of the professor's control.

Strengths: engaging, open-ended projects give students a good portfolio and a clearer sense of themselves as designers.
Weaknesses: vapid discussions left little to be desired.

4 hours is a really long time for a lecture, so I always ended up quite drained at the end of class. I did enjoy the variety in the class, since it was not only critique but also had some guest lectures

Strengths: diverse projects, constructive feedback, close-nit group
Weakness: not enough time spent critiquing projects - or spending too much time critiquing at the preliminary stage, talks that were not too relevant to the design task at hand

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: All design work was able to be completed digitally, except for the final project which we were encouraged to printbut this was not a requirement

I thought recorded presentations were a great idea - would love to be able to just watch on my own time. I also didn't really benefit from the breakout rooms, particularly when they were small, three person groups of students. Generally, in those small groups - we didn't know how much time to allot to each other and often ended super early with nothing else to do. I think that I had the best critiques when the class was split in half or all together.
I also really liked sharing work on Arena but that platform is so hard to navigate that I often just got lost and didn't know where to submit my work to. Some alternative to Arena would be great.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! If you want to continue down the graphic design path, this class had an array of fun assignments that will definitely improve your design skills

Yes, but this course requires students to have an open mind. There were people in our class who weren't interested in developing a methodology or didn't believe in it. I think that the fast past projects give you an opportunity to see patterns in your work, and you will only notice them if you're mind is open for it.
